description.narrative: Area Based Development Programme _United Nations Highlands Joint Programme in Papua New Guinea

activity-description.narrative: The Papua New Guinea Highlands Joint Programme for Peace and Development focusing in Hela and Southern Highlands to: 1. Support creation of peaceful and enabling conditions for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals, 2. Catalyse greater investments in equitable and sustainable human development

The Papua New Guinea Highlands Joint Programme for Peace and Development focusing in Hela and Southern Highlands to: 1. Support creation of peaceful and enabling conditions for achieving the Sustainable Development Goals, 2. Catalyse greater investments in equitable and sustainable human development

sector.narrative: Eradicate poverty in all its forms and dimensions

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative:
Outcome 1: By 2022, communities affected by conflict in the Highlands have increased capacity to promote and demand for peace and social cohesion 1. Proportion of population who believe decision-making is inclusive and responsive, by sex and age 2. Conflict-related deaths per 100,000 population, by sex, age and cause 3. Number of new conflicts, annual
Output 1.1: Women and youth are prepared for leadership roles in established community peace building mechanisms 1. Proportion of women & youth in decision-making roles participating in peace building mechanisms within communities 2. Number of women and youth trained on inclusive Peace Building processes 3. % conflicts mediated with participation of women and young people as mediators.
Output 1.2: Peace building and human rights monitoring skills and tools are entrenched in communities, churches/faith-based organizations and civil society organizations 1. Number of community compact/by-laws that promote peace and respect for human rights 2. Number of community leaders trained in leadership and conflict management skills 3. Number of community leaders promote conflict prevention and protection messages on ASF
Outcome 2: By 2022, Highlands’ communities and households have improved resilience to manage risks and mitigate shocks from conflict and manmade/ natural disasters 1. Change in coping strategies index (CSI/rCSI) 2. Proportion of informal employment in non-agriculture employment, by sex 3. Number of people participating in capacity development initiatives focusing on equitable and diversified economic growth
Output 2.1: Sustainable development and livelihood opportunities available to communities are increased 1. Number of income-generating livelihood activities generating employment and income for men, women and youth including vulnerable and marginalized individuals in villages 2. % of male household members actively contributing to subsistence agriculture
Output 2.2: Critical community support systems are p

Number of community compact/by-laws that promote peace and respect for human rights 2. Number of community leaders trained in leadership and conflict management skills 3. Number of community leaders promote conflict prevention and protection messages on ASF

Change in coping strategies index (CSI/rCSI) 2. Proportion of informal employment in non-agriculture employment, by sex 3. Output 2.2: Critical community support systems are p

OUTCOME 1: By 2022, communities affected by conflict in the Highlands have increased capacity to promote and demand for peace and social cohesion Output 1.2: Peace building skills and tools are entrenched in communities and churches/faith-based organizations Activity 1.2.6: Inter-community small grants projects as confidence-building measure that reinforces inter-communal partnership and joint ownership Activity 1.2.10: Training of local traditional community/tribal leaders with leadership/conflict resolution skills Activity 1.2.14: Conduct of inter- and intra-communal conflict assessment/scoping, facilitated mediation and follow-up community support
OUTCOME 2: By 2022, Highlands’ communities and households have improved resilience to manage risks and mitigate shocks from conflict and man-made/natural disasters. Output 2.1: Sustainable development and livelihood opportunities available to communities are increased. Activity 2.1.3: Reintegration of youth (ex-fighters) by connecting to local labour opportunities, targeted psycho-social support, counselling and mentoring
Outcome 4: By 2022, public institutions in the Highlands have people-centred, proactive and transparent/accountable systems to support effective leadership that promotes peace and security Output 4.1: Physical and non-physical institutional arrangements supporting/for local peace and development efforts established based on evidence Activity 4.1.9: Support post-conflict needs assessment to link at-peace communities with development assistance (as peace dividends)
Output 4.2: Information systems established to generate evidence and transfer knowledge on peacebuilding and conflict Activity 4.2.2: Conduct regular tracking, monitoring & mapping of inter- and intracommunal conflicts to support early warning and triggering of early action intervention
1.Community Awareness on conflict and peace carried out through the Catholic Diocese of Mendi 2.Rehabilitation of survivors of conflict through the Catholic Diocese of Mendi.

OUTCOME 1: By 2022, communities affected by conflict in the Highlands have increased capacity to promote and demand for peace and social cohesion Output 1.2: Peace building skills and tools are entrenched in communities and churches/faith-based organizations Activity 1.2.6: Inter-community small grants projects as confidence-building measure that reinforces inter-communal partnership and joint ownership Activity 1.2.10: Training of local traditional community/tribal leaders with leadership/conflict resolution skills Activity 1.2.14: Conduct of inter- and intra-communal conflict assessment/scoping, facilitated mediation and follow-up community support
OUTCOME 2: By 2022, Highlands’ communities and households have improved resilience to manage risks and mitigate shocks from conflict and man-made/natural disasters. Output 2.1: Sustainable development and livelihood opportunities available to communities are increased. Activity 2.1.3: Reintegration of youth (ex-fighters) by connecting to local labour opportunities, targeted psycho-social support, counselling and mentoring
Outcome 4: By 2022, public institutions in the Highlands have people-centred, proactive and transparent/accountable systems to support effective leadership that promotes peace and security Output 4.1: Physical and non-physical institutional arrangements supporting/for local peace and development efforts established based on evidence Activity 4.1.9: Support post-conflict needs assessment to link at-peace communities with development assistance (as peace dividends)
Output 4.2: Information systems established to generate evidence and transfer knowledge on peacebuilding and conflict Activity 4.2.2: Conduct regular tracking, monitoring & mapping of inter- and intracommunal conflicts to support early warning and triggering of early action intervention

Low-value grant agreement with CARE International signed to establish community grants mechanism Low-value grant agreement with Conciliation Resources signed to provide trainings to community leaders Catholic Dioceses of Mendi actively facilitating mediation support
Low-value grant agreement with Conciliation Resources signed to support provincial officials with conflict resolution trainings
A national consultant is being hired to develop community needs assessment tool Support to post conflict communities will start upon development of assessment tool
Discussions are ongoing with a potential organization to initiate the conflict tracking mechanism Monthly tracking reports will be developed once the conflict tracking mechanism is established
Low Value Grant Agreement with CARE International signed to organize district peace conferences Low Value Grant Agreement with CARE International signed to develop provincial development plans
Low Value Grant Agreement with CARE International signed to establish youth employment mechanism Low Value Grant Agreement with CARE International signed to support 100 youth
Baseline study is completed under the Framework of Highlands Joint Programme
